title: Can a person have a heart attack from thinking about it all the time? - Quora

response.answer_text: Stress is a factor, and the biggest risk factor for having a heart attack is already having had a heart attack before. Therefore, a person who has had a previous heart attack could (theoretically) stress themselves out with worrying about this fact. But taking cardio protective medication, and acknowledging that following the medical advice will reduce one's risk should reassure one that they are doing the right thing.
